turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Gentrification in Philadelphia.
turn.1: What happened in Chinatown in regards to gentrification?
turn.2: After two years of the Chinatown community fighting it, the plan was thrown out.
turn.3: What happened with the fight against gentrification?
turn.4: In the mid- 1960s, the Pennsylvania Department of Transportation (PennDOT) announced plans to build the Vine Street Expressway.
turn.6: In 1973 PennDOT included the demolition of a building on 10th and Vine Streets and Holy Redeemer Catholic Church.
turn.7: Did the people protesting have any success?
turn.8: When the demolition crew arrived, they found Chinese youth protesting on the demolition machines.
turn.10: They managed to slow the construction of the Vine Street Expressway, but in the end it was still built.
turn.11: Was there anything else that happened with gentrification?
turn.12: The Gallery shopping mall and the Pennsylvania Convention Center are other completed projects that limit the expansion of Chinatown and which proceeded in spite of community objection.
